OVERVIEW


This conference brings together industry leaders to discuss the significant impact of GAAP accounting changes to the energy industry and financial institutions. As FASB standards align accounting operation more towards contractbased portfolio valuation and fair market value, the energy industry faces ever growing complexity in their finance and accounting operations. In addition, the new Energy Policy Act of 2005 has changed the dynamics of FERC and State regulatory requirements simultaneously. Hear how energy risk management and finance/accounting professionals, rating agencies, and investment banks have sorted through and prepared for these changes.
 
WHO SHOULD ATTEND

                      This conference is suited to investors, energy executives, corporate risk managers, finance and accounting directors, and industry professionals involved in the oversight of risk management, and finance/accounting operations for energy companies and investment banks.
